intro: Henckelia inaequalis, commonly known as the unequal henckelia, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf structures and often vibrant flowers. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers that appear in late summer. Its leaves are typically alternate and have a rough, textured surface, which is a common trait among members of its family. Henckelia inaequalis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and rocky slopes.
